title: Kluz Peace Prize 2024
tagline: Celebrating those who promote peace and resolve conflicts

winners.overview:
The 2024 Kluz Prize for PeaceTech was awarded to Harshwardhan Zala, CEO and Co-Founder of Aerobotics7, and Urvashi Kikani, CTO and Co-Founder, for their groundbreaking work in landmine detection and UXO removal using AI and autonomous systems.

Special distinctions were presented to Håvard Hegre, Director of VIEWS, for the Use of AI for Peace, with Simon Polichinel von der Maase accepting the award on his behalf as a dedicated researcher for VIEWS; Max Cooper, Principal Research Scientist and Science Team Lead at Lunasonde, for Space Technology for Peace; and Joel Myhre (Jowl MEER-a), DEEP Project Coordinator for the Danish Refugee Council, for Humanitarian Impact with their DEEP platform.

The 2024 Kluz Prize for PeaceTech was awarded in September 2024, on the eve of the International Day of Peace during the 79th United Nations General Assembly. The event was celebrated in New York City, recognizing innovators and pioneers using technology to foster a more peaceful and secure future.
